name: Sierra Lodge

reviews.text: Stay here at the sierra lodge it is the easiest, cheapest, cleanest, has the nicest staff that are more than loyal to the customers. Ask for Mr. Deeds he will take of you! very accessible as well, one minute away from everything in town.
reviews.title: Best in town, Hands down.

reviews.text: My husband and I stay here every time we come up to Mammoth. The rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable and the staff is excellent! We got in late on Friday and there were no parking spots left so the night desk clerk moved his car so we could have a spot. Then I accidentally left my pillow in the room when we checked out. I called and Mark & Steven found it and sent it to me! Excellent customer service.
reviews.title: Excellent staff, best value & quality in Mammoth!

reviews.text: I stayed here while skiing three days at Mammoth in April of 2013. The room was large with a sofa, small deck, microwave, and refrigerator. The king size bed was very comfortable and quite welcome at sleep time. The only view is of buildings across the street, but I'm skiing all day, what do I care. Across the street is Angels. A nice restaurant with reasonable lunch and dinner prices. The hotel does have a light continental breakfast, cereal, bagels, coffee. However, I chose to walk a short distance to a restaurant that served a big hot breakfast. There is a nice lounge room with a fireplace and there is a mountain view from this room. The staff were friendly and helpful. On the main street in front of the lodge there is a bus stop where you can catch a ride up to the slopes. It's free and comes every 15 or 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Great Bed - Nice Outdoor Jacuzzi - Price is Right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Truly, a great value! You know how they say "dollar for dollar, the Subaru WRX or the Mustang Boss are the fastest cars for the money." Well, the same can be said for the quality of the Sierra Lodge. I'm a research guy. Love Consumer Reports. Before my trip, I researched the heck out of all the available lodgings in Mammoth. If I seem a bit fanatical, that's the way I get when my research proves true, and that's what Sierra Lodge did on every level. Did I want an in-room jacuzzi, no. Did I want an in-room jacuzzi, no. Did I appreciate the covered parking and outside ski lockers and complimentary continental breakfast, HECK YES! This place is everything you need and nothing you don't. The service, the cleanliness, the rooms, location, everything; was better than I expected. In fact, I found Sierra Lodge to be better in most aspects than many of the $$$ and $$$$ lodges.
reviews.title: !! Hands down, the Best Value in Mammoth !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love to location which is convenient to shops, great food, and bus lines. The room was bigger than expected and the beds were amazing!! The manager said the beds were brand new which is a huge plus. Those of us who are barely over 25 can appreciate a good bed after a great day of boarding.
reviews.title: Convenient, clean, friendly staff, and pet friendly

reviews.text: We stayed there two nights. Our room was very big, with a comfortable bed. Nice stuff. A little bit old school tv, but we didn't care, cause we spend our days outside. Very nice c immunity room. A very hot hot tub outside, opened till 10 pm. Very nice for relaxing after a long day in the nature.
reviews.title: Liked it a lot

reviews.text: You can watch the stars while using it. Price was absolutely ok. We used the washing machine there, everything worked fine.
reviews.title: Amazing - Even in the summertime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's vry close, about three miles to the lakes, and you can walk to some restaurants in town.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: One of our best stays everytime we spend a few nights here. This place is going to satisfy all your needs when it comes to skiing, snowboarding and everything, but even in the summertime it's absolutely amazing and relaxed. Rooms are generously big, most of them have a balcony, the hotel in general is very clean and has something oldschool to it.
reviews.title: Comfortable place, excellent staff

reviews.text: Staff is also very funny and friendly, location is excellent, there's a parking lot under the hotel, and even the continental (!) breakfast is good. Uh, I almost forgot: There's a fun bar right across the street, you can also get Pasta and Pizza there, in case you get hungry or need to kill some time, or even drop off your kids, because they have an arcade in there :)
reviews.title: Hottub movie 1988. A little inconvenient but very clean

reviews.text: Stayed one night on our drive from Vegas to Yosemite. Perfect stop, only a 6 hour drive from Vegas and under an hour the next morning to the East gate of the park.
reviews.title: Great pick for Yosemite visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was huge and very clean and the bed was super comfy. Breakfast was included in the price, nothing fancy but substantial enough to last us until lunch.
reviews.title: Comfortable small hotel; outstanding value for money

reviews.text: Only 15 minute walk to Mammoth Lakes village where there are plenty of choices for food or there is a restaurant right next door and another across the road.
reviews.title: Older hotel, but clean and comfortable with a few added surprises

reviews.text: I'd definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Pleasant but not for snobs.

reviews.text: We have been regular summer guests for many years. Staff are very competent, friendly, and quick to respond to requests. We have not noticed any staff turnover. The housekeeping is immaculate. The rooms and beds are comfortable. The common room for getting together with friends and/or family is a big plus, as are the spa and the covered parking. The Sierra Lodge offers outstanding value for money.
reviews.title: Mammoth Motocross Trip

reviews.text: From the 1st day of dealing with Sierra Lodge to check out time, I was totally impressed. I called 3 months in advance to hold 20 rooms, I had absolutely no problems, they held them almost until the day we arrived. I brought 35 people, and everybody had a great comment about this place.The beds are so comfortable, the prices affordable, the community room was a great place for a large group to meet and visit while we were there. The staff was amazing, helpful with all our needs. even helping me make dinner reservations for 35 people. We totally enjoyed our stay at Sierra Lodge.
reviews.title: Bring your group here!

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and gave good vibes. Rooms had refrigerator, microwave, sink, dishes, table, couch, and were quiet. The only down side was there was no elevator. We were a large group, and staff was glad to please us.
reviews.title: A Warm Feeling

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights this past week. Our room was very spacious, bed perfectly comfy, front desk extremely friendly and helpful. Yes it is a bit "outdated" but not at all in a cheap way. The free breakfast is what you would expect, basic, bagels, English muffins, toast, cereal, a few pastries, nothing fancy. The only complaint we had was not enough seating in the breakfast area. Definitely one thing they could improve on. Other than that our stay was great!
reviews.title: Spacious room,good price.

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in a spacious, airy room that had a small kitchenette plus a plush, comfy sofa that made it feel more like a small studio apartment than a hotel room. The "Great Room" where breakfast is served and guests clearly congregate evenings in ski season (wonderful big fireplace, so we can imagine the ambience) was a bonus, as was the outdoor hot tub located on the adjacent deck. Great way to wind down after hiking or skiing, or just driving the winding mountain roads to get there. We appreciated the ceramic coffee mugs set out for the guests rather than the usual styrofoam, although we do wish there had been more seating, since the place was full and we ended up juggling coffee and breakfast plates while standing over a small table to the side. (Our room was up the stairs, so we opted not to bring our breakfast there).
reviews.title: Spacious and Comfortable, with Outdoor Hot Tub!

reviews.text: We also liked that we could walk to Mammoth Lakes Village, rather than having to fire up the motorcycle again after a long day in the saddle.We were a bit disappointed, however, to discover that there were no sidewalks, so that we had to walk uphill to the village on the busy road, which at least had a bike trail most of the way. As a bonus, though, we picked up some wonderful giant pine cones that had fallen along the roadside, and we will enjoy seeing them on our mantel come Christmas. And it wasn't far at all to walk, much better than lodging down or up the hill and having to drive and park.
reviews.title: Very Good Ski Lodge

description: We are Mammoth's first 100% non-smoking hotel. Perfectly located near the slopes (1.5 miles), in the middle of town, we offer affordable, clean rooms and great hospitality. Amenities include free WI-FI, free continental breakfast, cable TV, kitchenette, telephone, hairdryer, outdoor spa, and underground parking. We are located .75 miles from the new Village and the Village gondola and walking distance to restaurants and shops.
